item.text: The Lord spoke to Moses after the death of Aaron’s two sons when they approached the presence of the Lord and died,

and the Lord said to Moses: “Tell Aaron your brother that he must not enter at any time into the Holy Place inside the special curtain in front of the atonement lid that is on the ark so that he may not die, for I will appear in the cloud over the atonement lid.
“In this way Aaron is to enter into the sanctuary—with a young bull for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering.

He must <st data-num="03847" class="">put on</st> a <st data-num="06944" class="">holy</st> <st data-num="0906" class="">linen</st> <st data-num="03801" class="">tunic</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="0906" class="">linen</st> <st data-num="04370" class="">leggings</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">are</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to cover</st> his <st data-num="01320" class="">body</st>,<n id="2" /> and he is to <st data-num="02296" class="">wrap</st> himself with a <st data-num="0906" class="">linen</st> <st data-num="073" class="">sash</st><n id="3" /> and <st data-num="06801" class="">wrap</st> his head with a <st data-num="0906" class="">linen</st> <st data-num="04701" class="">turban</st>.<n id="4" /> <st data-num="01992" class="">They</st> are <st data-num="06944" class="">holy</st> <st data-num="0899" class="">garments</st>, so he must <st data-num="07364" class="">bathe</st><n id="5" /> his <st data-num="01320" class="">body</st> in <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> and <st data-num="03847" class="">put</st> them <st data-num="03847" class="">on</st>.

He must also <st data-num="03947" class="">take</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="08163" class="">male</st> <st data-num="05795" class="">goats</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0854" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="05712" class="">congregation</st> of the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> for a <st data-num="02403" class="">sin offering</st> and <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> <st data-num="0352" class="">ram</st> for a <st data-num="05930" class="">burnt offering</st>.

Then <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st> is to <st data-num="07126" class="">present</st> the <st data-num="02403" class="">sin-offering</st> <st data-num="06499" class="">bull</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> is for himself and is to <st data-num="03722" class="">make atonement</st> <st data-num="01157" class="">on behalf of</st> himself and his <st data-num="01004" class="">household</st>.
Next he must take the two goats and stand them before the Lord at the entrance of the Meeting Tent,
and Aaron is to cast lots over the two goats, one lot for the Lord and one lot for Azazel.
Aaron must then present the goat which has been designated by lot for the Lord, and he is to make it a sin offering,
but the goat which has been designated by lot for Azazel is to be stood alive before the Lord to make atonement on it by sending it away into the desert to Azazel.
“Aaron is to present the sin-offering bull which is for himself, and he is to make atonement on behalf of himself and his household. He is to slaughter the sin-offering bull which is for himself,
and take a censer full of coals of fire from the altar before the Lord and a full double handful of finely ground fragrant incense, and bring them inside the curtain.
He must then put the incense on the fire before the Lord, and the cloud of incense will cover the atonement lid which is above the ark of the testimony, so that he will not die.

Then he is to take some of the blood of the bull and sprinkle it with his finger on the eastern face of the atonement lid, and in front of the atonement lid he is to sprinkle some of the blood seven times with his finger.

“Aaron must then slaughter the sin-offering goat which is for the people. He is to bring its blood inside the curtain, and he is to do with its blood just as he did to the blood of the bull: He is to sprinkle it on the atonement lid and in front of the atonement lid.

So<n id="1" /> he is to <st data-num="03722" class="">make atonement</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> the <st data-num="06944" class="">Holy Place</st> from the <st data-num="02932" class="">impurities</st> of the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> and from their <st data-num="06588" class="">transgressions</st> with regard to <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> their <st data-num="02403" class="">sins</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="03651" class="">thus</st> he is to <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st> for the <st data-num="04150" class="">Meeting</st> <st data-num="0168" class="">Tent</st> which <st data-num="07931" class="">resides</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> them in the <st data-num="08432" class="">midst</st> of their <st data-num="02932" class="">impurities</st>.

Nobody is to be in the Meeting Tent when he enters to make atonement in the Holy Place until he goes out, and he has made atonement on his behalf, on behalf of his household, and on behalf of the whole assembly of Israel.

“Then Aaron is to go out to the altar which is before the Lord and make atonement for it. He is to take some of the blood of the bull and some of the blood of the goat, and put it all around on the horns of the altar.
Then he is to sprinkle on it some of the blood with his finger seven times, and cleanse and consecrate it from the impurities of the Israelites.
“When Aaron has finished purifying the Holy Place, the Meeting Tent, and the altar, he is to present the live goat.

<st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st> is to <st data-num="05564" class="">lay</st> his <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">hands</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st> of the <st data-num="02416" class="">live</st> <st data-num="08163" class="">goat</st> and <st data-num="03034" class="">confess</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> it <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05771" class="">iniquities</st> of the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> their <st data-num="06588" class="">transgressions</st> in regard to <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> their <st data-num="02403" class="">sins</st>,<n id="1" /> and thus he is to <st data-num="05414" class="">put</st> them<n id="2" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="07218" class="">head</st> of the <st data-num="08163" class="">goat</st> and <st data-num="07971" class="">send</st> it <st data-num="07971" class="">away</st> into the <st data-num="04057" class="">desert</st> by the <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st> of a <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> standing <st data-num="06261" class="">ready</st>.<n id="3" />
The goat is to bear on itself all their iniquities into an inaccessible land, so he is to send the goat away into the desert.
“Aaron must then enter the Meeting Tent and take off the linen garments which he had put on when he entered the sanctuary, and leave them there.

Then he must bathe his body in water in the Holy Place, put on his clothes, and go out and make his burnt offering and the people’s burnt offering. So he is to make atonement on behalf of himself and the people.
“Then he is to offer up the fat of the sin offering in smoke on the altar,

and the one who <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> the <st data-num="08163" class="">goat</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">away</st> to <st data-num="05799" class="">Azazel</st><n id="1" /> must <st data-num="03526" class="">wash</st> his <st data-num="0899" class="">clothes</st>, <st data-num="07364" class="">bathe</st> his <st data-num="01320" class="">body</st> in <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>, and <st data-num="0310 03651">afterward</st> he may <st data-num="0935" class="">reenter</st> the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st>.

The <st data-num="06499" class="">bull</st> of the <st data-num="02403" class="">sin offering</st> and the <st data-num="08163" class="">goat</st> of the <st data-num="02403" class="">sin offering</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">whose</st> <st data-num="01818" class="">blood</st> was <st data-num="0935" class="">brought</st> to <st data-num="03722" class="">make atonement</st> in the <st data-num="06944" class="">Holy Place</st>, must be <st data-num="03318" class="">brought</st> <st data-num="02351" class="">outside</st> the <st data-num="04264" class="">camp</st><n id="1" /> and their <st data-num="05785" class="">hide</st>, their <st data-num="01320" class="">flesh</st>, and their <st data-num="06569" class="">dung</st> must be <st data-num="08313" class="">burned</st> <st data-num="0784">up</st>,<n id="2" />
and the one who burns them must wash his clothes and bathe his body in water, and afterward he may reenter the camp.

“This is to be a perpetual statute for you. In the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, you must humble yourselves and do no work of any kind, both the native citizen and the resident foreigner who lives in your midst,
for on this day atonement is to be made for you to cleanse you from all your sins; you must be clean before the Lord.
It is to be a Sabbath of complete rest for you, and you must humble yourselves. It is a perpetual statute.
“The priest who is anointed and ordained to act as high priest in place of his father is to make atonement. He is to put on the linen garments, the holy garments,

and he is to <st data-num="03722" class="">purify</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="06944" class="">Most</st> <st data-num="04720" class="">Holy Place</st>,<n id="2" /> he is to <st data-num="03722" class="">purify</st> the <st data-num="04150" class="">Meeting</st> <st data-num="0168" class="">Tent</st> and the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st>,<n id="3" /> and he is to <st data-num="03722" class="">make atonement</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st><n id="4" /> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priests</st> and <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> of the <st data-num="06951" class="">assembly</st>.
This is to be a perpetual statute for you to make atonement for the Israelites for all their sins once a year.” So he did just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
